In this coding problem we check to see if one string is a rotation of another. To solve this problem we need
to be able to check if the string is a match even if it wraps around in the array or is a match when reading
backwards. The key to solving this problem is to recognize that we can use the mod % function to calculate the
index when looking at the array for the perspective of wrapping around

check_string_regular_forwards_match.Title: check_string_regular_forwards_match
Description: Here the string to compare is a match in the forwards direction and does not require a wraparound check

check_string_forwards_wraparound_match.Title: check_string_forwards_wraparound_match
Description: Here the string to compare is a match in the forwards direction and requires a wraparound check

check_string_backwards_match.Title: check_string_backwards_match
Description: Here the string to compare is a match in the backwards direction and does not require a wraparound check

check_string_backwards_wraparound_match.Title: check_string_backwards_wraparound_match
Description: Here the string to compare is a match in the backwards direction and requries a wraparound check

check_forwards_string_no_match.Title: check_forwards_string_no_match
Description: Here the string to compare is not a match either in the forwards or backwards directions

check_backwards_no_match.Title: check_backwards_no_match
Description: Here the string to compare is not a match either in the forwards or backwards directions
In this example we remove duplicate characters from an array using an in place sorting algorithm. Since we
complete this in only one loop then the time complexity is O(n) In remove_duplicates we accomplish this by
sorting the passed in array, in remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer we use a string ascii value map to assist
in the comparisons.

remove_duplicates_in_place_string1.Title: remove_duplicates_in_place_string1
Description: This algorithm uses a duplicates pointer to store the index at which all of the elements will be duplicates. As we
loop through the string we move duplicates with a swap behind the duplicates pointer and then increment the
pointer by +1.

remove_duplicates_in_place_string2.Title: remove_duplicates_in_place_string2
Description: This algorithm uses a duplicates pointer to store the index at which all of the elements will be duplicates. As we
loop through the string we move duplicates with a swap behind the duplicates pointer and then increment the
pointer by +1.

remove_duplicates_in_place_string3.Title: remove_duplicates_in_place_string3
Description: This algorithm uses a duplicates pointer to store the index at which all of the elements will be duplicates. As we
loop through the string we move duplicates with a swap behind the duplicates pointer and then increment the
pointer by +1.

remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_st.Title: remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_string1
Description: This algorithm will first copy all of the a-z and A-Z characters into an array and then use that array as a
tracker of whether or not these characters have been seen before during the loop.Once the character is found it
is marked as true in the a-z A-Z character buffer and copied into the tail pointer of the original string
string pointer.

remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_st.Title: remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_string2
Description: This algorithm will first copy all of the a-z and A-Z characters into an array and then use that array as a
tracker of whether or not these characters have been seen before during the loop.Once the character is found it
is marked as true in the a-z A-Z character buffer and copied into the tail pointer of the original string
string pointer.

remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_st.Title: remove_duplicates_using_string_buffer_string3
Description: This algorithm will first copy all of the a-z and A-Z characters into an array and then use that array as a
tracker of whether or not these characters have been seen before during the loop.Once the character is found it
is marked as true in the a-z A-Z character buffer and copied into the tail pointer of the original string
